page.title: 19Village shops in Bubbenhall
page.content: The post office in Bubbenhall is the only shop in the village and most daily shopping is done here.The post office is in a fairly secluded area at the bottom of the main street next to the playing field.The sub postmaster thought they missed many customers who where passing through the village,because of it's remoteness.The post office is made of corrugated plastic and built so it butts onto the side of a house called Ludgates View.The old post office closed down in 1960 it is now a house called The Hollys.A new post office did not open until 1970 so they did not have a shop for 10 years.Village people do not visit the store for most of their shopping ,they just come for the essentials,mainly shopping in Leamington Spa and Coventry.
